runs.comm: length delivery, straightening on the middle and off, punched back down the pitch
back of length, again holding its line on the middle and off line, punched to cover...
short in length, on the middle, tries to turn it to the on side, misses and it bounds away off the pad
lovely delivery, curving in around the off stump with bit of bounce, the bat goes outside the line and the ball passes the off stump
backs away a touch to slash it down to third man for a single
flash and a miss. It was a length delivery slanting away, he tried to slash it away but couldn't connect. Fine first over from Mash.
full in length, around the off stump, stabbed off the inner edge to backward square leg
slightly short in length, angling away, punched away to cover point where Raqibul makes a fine diving stop to his right
back of length, straightening on the middle, defended to the on side of the pitch
fuller, drivable length, outside off, around 135 kmph, swing and a miss there.
bouncer but sails down the leg side for a wide ...
Another short-pitched delivery, again drifting down the leg side
fuller, straighter, driven on the up to cover
good length delivery cutting away from the batsman who allows it to pass him
tries to create room by backing away a bit, but can't get much power behind the cut and the ball rolls away to backward point
short in length, at the hips, runs away to fine leg
leans forward to push it towards mid-off for a quick single
full in length, straight on the middle, tapped to the off side ... required rate is now 7.62

Mashrafee strikes. It was full and on the pads, Bray tried to flick it away but got a inside-edge on to his pad and it popped up for cover point to run in and take the dolly. The strangle has produced a wicket.

length delivery on the middle and leg, Niall O'Brien turns it to fine leg. O'Brien slips while turning for the second run and he hobbles across for the second run. He had already a nasty little fall while fielding in the end overs.
full and angling away, slashed to third man where Mashrafee lunges to his left to stop it
full in length, just outside off stump, pushed out to the off side
140.2 kmph sharp bouncer and the batsman goes down under quickly .. Neil O'Brien is still limping out there
137 kmph full delivery and Neil thrashes it straight past the bowler ... First signs of real intent from Ireland
takes a couple of steps down the track. Rubel slips in a slower one outside off, pushed to right of cover point
moves outside leg stump and thumps a full length delivery on the stumps inside-out over wide mid-off region
Fabulous flick pick-up stroke over midwicket. It was the slower one, he took a step forward to chip it over the on side boundary
drags it short and Niel pulls it powerfully but can't beat the square leg fielder
Another fine flick . What a fine piece of timing. He took a step out, leaned across to clip it high over square leg
length delivery on the middle and off, tapped down the pitch

The limping hobbling Niall is having a crack at this target. This time the swat-flick, sort of a scooped flick over deep square leg. It appeared as if he had hit it straight up but it carried over the ropes
leans forward to push it to the on side. Neil has a runner for him now
Niall pulls off yet another boundary. He rocked back to play a feisty forcing shot through covers
pushes this to the off side
Niall keeps going for his shots. He moved outside leg and went for the cut. It flew off the top edge but cleared the off-side fielders and it runs away to the short square boundary
coming in towards off stump, punched off the back foot to cover
gets forward to defend back to the bowler
Another fine cut shot. This time from Porterfield. It curved in from outside off, from slightly short of length, he rocked back to flash it through backward point
fuller, leans forward to defend to the off side
goes right back to punch to cover
another one skidding on towards off stump, cut away but straight to point
on the middle and leg, quickish, turned to square leg
gets forward to drive to sweeper cover for a single
slightly short in length, edged to short third man.. direct hit at the non-striker's end but Bray, running for Niall, makes it in time
loopy flighted outside off stump, lunges out to defend and it turns n and threads the bat and pad gap and Mushfiqur doesn't collect it cleanly
leans forward to push it to the off side
turns in from outside off, goes back to punch to cover
plays the reverse sweep, will pick up a single
turns in from the good length, from outside off, defended on the front foot. Fine over.
a touch short in length, cut away to deep backward point. 50 of the partnership is up
moves back to open the bat-face and tap it to short third man and they scamper across for the single
threatens to step out before pushing back and punching the ball to cover
shuffles to the off side and works it through midwicket
flatter, quicker , from round the stumps, misses the stumps and it goes away off the pad. Shout for lbw but turned down. Hawk eye hows it hitting the stumps!
slips towards the middle and leg, beats the prod and strikes the pad
worked past square leg for a single
leans across to flick from the off stump line to deep midwicket
steps down the track and drives to long-on
Niall holes out to long-off. It was a nice loopy flighted delivery outside off stump and Niall lunged out to lift it straight to the fielder...
moves outside off, Shakib slows up the pace and pushed back down the track
quicker from Shakib and Porterfield uses the pace to late cut it past backward point
from round the stumps, spins down leg and runs away off the pad
short in length, punched to deep midwicket for a single
flighted full, dug out to cover
turns in to the middle stump line, punched down to long-on
moves outside leg, creates room and cuts the full ball from the stumps wide of  deep cover
flighted around off stump, squeezed to backward point
quickish, short in length, cut away to deep cover for a single
what a soft dismissal. It stopped on Porterfield a touch and he ended up pushing it tamely back to the bowler. Razzak roars!
shout for lbw but perhaps, missing leg stump. He shuffled across, tried to turn the delivery turning in to the on side but failed to connect
paddles it to fine-leg for a single
quick arm ball, short of length , cut away from the off stump to deep point
backs away to cut from the middle to cover .. risky singly but the bowler doesn't collect the throw .. it could have got interesting had he taken it
comes down the track and pings long-off
floated full on the leg and middle, tries to paddle away but will pick up a leg bye
reverse sweeps from middle to short third man for a quick single
stays back to punch the skidder to wide long-on for couple of runs
charges down the track and has a big heave. The ball flies off the inner edge past the leg stump. Ashraful gives chase but dives too early in the end and the ball runs away to the boundary
leans forward to tap to square leg. Mush, the keeper, realising that they might turn for the second, hares after the ball himself
pushed away through the off side for a single. 52 from 41 balls
short and wide but cut straight to point. Opportunity for a four missed there
looped in with bounce, goes for the pull but is surprised by the extra bounce and is hit on the chest
another pull shot attempted, runs off the body to short third man ... keeper screams for the throw but it never comes
charges down the track, Razzak fires it in the blockhole but to his agony, sees the ball run away off the outer edge to third man
floated full, dragged to deep midwicket
short of length delivery, bouncing past the attempted cut and goes to the 'keeper

Mash and Ash combo strike. Wilson crashed the full length delivery  - it was the slower one - straight to Ashraful at covers. Ash is overjoyed. He roars and roars as his team-mates converge on him. Great scenes here. Thrilling and filled with tension.
on a length, around the off stump, guided to backward point region
full delivery on the off stump line, paddled away to short fine-leg fielder for a single. The throw comes in at the striker's end but misses the stumps. Had it hit, it would have been a run out
Mash errs by gifting a full toss on the pads, turned past short fine-leg and the Irish supporters in the crowd find their voice again.
length delivery on the off stump, steered to point region for a single
skids on from a length, towards the middle stump, worked towards square leg
from over the wicket, full, really full outside off, big swing attempted but no wood on leatehr
goes for the reverse sweep this time and gets a single to deep backward point
What a biggie from Kevin! He walked towards the off stump, fetched the full delivery from the off stump and swung it high over midwicket boundary
leans forward to push to point
he moves towards the off stump again but this time just paddles it for a single .. but he retains the strike.
bangs it short around off, Kevin pulls it high in the air, all the fielders look up but it falls safely in the wide midwicket region
Kevin Kevin goes the chant here .. Rubel drags in another short delivery and this time, Kevin lashes it superbly over extra cover... fine fine shot under pressure. ash has a chat with Rubel
Another short delivery attempted by the youngster but he pushes it wide outside off. Pressure.
Yet another short delivery , Rubel goes for the pull but cant' put bat to ball ...
Fabulicious hit! Take a bow Kevin. He moves outside leg stump, Rubel put this in the slot and Kevin whacked it inside-out through wide mid-off. That screamed to the boundary
full and on the middle, dragged to deep midwicket for a single..
length delivery on the middle and leg, shapes to tap it to the on side but it goes to the off side  off the pad ...
What a top shot! Under pressure, he has pulled off a reverse sweep in style. It was on the off and middle, he opened up his stance and crashed it over short third man
pushed through the point region for a single
moves to the off stump - he has shown a liking to do that against the left-arm spinner - but adjusts to the ball outside off and pushes it calmly to cover point
turned to fineleg and they rush across for a quick single. It needed a direct hit to catch him short of the crease
Kevin the hero! He moved to the off side and had one almighty big swing over deep square leg. Whaddaplayyaaaa!
retains the strike with a drive through the on side
Another short delivery,  Kevin stands tall to carve it high over cover point. The Irish in the crowd are singing now. Great scenes here

Irish eyes are smiling ... What a stunning knock from Kevin. He thrashed this one over mid-off for the match-winning boundary.  Kevin and Niall with the bat have completed the job started by their bowlers
